text: and it's time for a review of this new
portrayal of guilt project devil music
this is the fourth full-length LP from
Austin Texas loud rock outfit portrayal
of guilt who've been turning heads with
their chaotic blend of black metal and
screamo for a handful of years now going
back to their pretty solid debut 2018's
let pain be your guide they gave fans
another helping of much the same sound
with the following we are always alone
but follow that record up so quickly
with Christ [ __ ] the same year just
later that fall that this LP just kind
of slipped by me but I do want to bring
this record up because I think it marks
a significant change in style and
direction for portrayal of guilt or POG
because it's sort of like the band
suddenly began to drop this emo Fusion
pretense in order to just start making
some of the most vile metal music out
there today which honestly is a mission
I can get down with especially since
they're going noticeably harder on this
new LP here and doing so with an
interesting twist because the first five
tracks on this record are a brutal heavy
and crushing series of cuts that bring
together a buzzing sludge riffs pounding
drums and deafeningly brittle black
metal vocals the opener one last Taste
Of Heaven is just a total Onslaught a
complete and utter riff vest that ends
off with these sliding guitar passages
toward the very end that are very
mesmerizing overall it's a very strong
one minute and 36 second tone Setter the
next track Untitled kicks things off in
a more Dynamic manner with a lot of
blast beats and a clean guitar tone that
has a very bold chorus effect on them
yes there is a lot more room to breathe
in this mix but it's still a pretty
Savage sound between the Monstrous drum
fills and very ghoulish vocals and at
the halfway point there's an interesting
Groove change the guitars have almost
like a a springy aesthetic to them and I
feel like I'm I don't know listening to
the soundtrack to a mosh pit loaded with
psychotic serial killers it's crazy but
I will say the abrupt ending at the very
finish does murder the fun a bit I find
the progression on the song Burning hand
to hit a lot harder the track also
serves as a moment to breathe in the
flow of the album as well there are some
Sinister and weary opening guitar
passages that eventually lead to these
sections of spoken word that are
underscored by building layers of
guitars that get more and more intense
as the track progresses along it's
simple but it does segue really tightly
into the following Where Angels come to
die which is a desperately edgy title
and I will say generally the edginess of
this project is pretty high however the
music on this track does sound like the
Sonic equivalent to a giant space
station size meat grinder that you could
feed Angels into the creepy whispered
lead vocal passages to follow from here
are great and the section of throttling
black metal toward the very end of the
song is so fast is so pummeling is so
Soul crushing it feels like I am just
flying in a chair at 20 G's through the
desert on a rocket from here there's
another tight segue into the song devil
music the title track and if you thought
the first four songs on this thing were
gruesome this one's gonna up the ante
not just in terms of extremity and
volume but there are so many twisted and
dissonant guitar passages all over the
cut too which sound as unpredictable and
as threatening as a crazy guy cannibal
coming at you with a scalpel I will say
the most final moments of the track are
kind of mild but the thick and sludgy
Crescendo that comes just before is most
definitely a serious high point of
intensity on the record so up to this
point we have an album that is killer
it's noisy it's cathartic it's a really
solid five songs but the record has five
more tracks to go and the whole thing
works in two parts because the next five
songs on the album are the same as the
first five songs except now they're
rearranged with all these orchestral
strings bass cello violin some horns and
more Primal drums too you and honestly
the results are pretty interesting not
only because a lot of the time it sounds
nearly as deadly as all the cuts with
electric guitar but the strings and lack
of distortion actually reveal a lot of
compositional nuances that kind of get
lost in the Mayhem and Chaos of the five
tracks that kind of Kick the record off
as they're originally done plus you get
additional little details like the
chaotic metallic perks throughout the
midpoint of burning hand the spoken word
passages I'll say hit even harder in
this sort of toned down context the
authoritative horn sections that are
added to Where Angels come to die are
incredible the thick rushes of strings
in this version hit almost as hard as
the distorted bass and guitar on the
original it's regal but somehow still
grisly and on the closing version of the
title track the Band hits another
intensity Peak instrumentally with the
horns and strings stacking even higher
for a dissonant and mind-blowing finale
considering all the Wild and sour guitar
notes flying all over the original
version of that track the band had a lot
to play with there as far as the string
arrangements and they really kind of
took advantage so that's the record in a
nutshell you have a a very tight
gruesome heavy extreme five songs and
then those tracks are just redone uh but
in string Arrangement form the tracks
themselves I think hit hard are
interesting are visceral and cathartic
and hearing them two different ways
certainly does provide an interesting
Dynamic does part of me wish instead we
got like just a you know a complete
album of uh 10 or 12 or 13 original
something like that maybe cause while I
do like the stylistic switch the band
pulled off here hearing the same five
songs all over again isn't exactly the
most exciting prospect even if uh
instrumentally they're completely
reinvented I'm feeling a light two
decent seven on this one transition have
